content.question:
Four different liquid compounds in flasks at <math alttext="20 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> are represented above. The table below identifies the compounds. Flask C shows the most particles in the vapor phase. Which of the following is not shown in the model but best helps to explain why flask C must contain pentane?

Name
 Chemical Formula
 Boiling Point <math alttext="degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

Pentane
 <math alttext="C H 3 C H 2 C H 2 C H 2 C H 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>
 36

Hexane
 <math alttext="C H 3 C H 2 C H 2 C H 2 C H 2 C H 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>
 69

Heptane
 <math alttext="C H 3 C H 2 C H 2 C H 2 C H 2 C H 2 C H 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>
 98

Octane
 <math alttext="C H 3 C H 2 C H 2 C H 2 C H 2 C H 2 C H 2 C H 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>
 126

choices.label: The random motion of the particles within the liquids
The relative speeds of the vapor particles in each flask
The strength of the intermolecular forces between the particles in the liquids
The structural formula of the molecules of the liquid and vapor in each flask

content.answer: The strength of the intermolecular forces between the particles in the liquids

skill.text: 4.D: Explain the degree to which a model or representation describes the connection between particulate-level properties and macroscopic properties.
